abstract.p: World Bridge Championships continue, Maastricht, Netherlands (S)

block.p: The United States open team continued to struggle here today in the World Bridge Championships. The team lost a close match to the Netherlands 14-16 but then defeated Russia 20-10.

This followed an opening day in which the American players defeated Bangladesh 20-10 but then lost to Hungary 8-22. Their total of 62 victory points, 2 over the average, left them 10 short of a qualifying position. Leading in their qualifying pool, with four to qualify for playoffs next week, is Australia with 89 points. Each pool has 18 teams. In the other three pools Austria, England and Italy are leading.

The United States women's team also had a difficult day, winning narrowly against Israel 16-14 but losing to Britain, 13-17. After five matches, the team's total is now 79, 4 over average. The team is ninth in its qualifying pool, from which eight will qualify next week. Leading in its pool of 20 teams is Austria with 102. Germany leads the other pool with 112.
